1.45.text:
MALE SPEAKER: All
right, hey everyone.

3.03.text:
Thank you so much
for coming out.

4.40.text:
I'm super-excited to introduce
our speaker today Jia Jiang.

8.51.text:
Jia Jiang is the author
of "Rejection Proof.

10.67.text:
It's his story of 100
days of rejection.

13.57.text:
So to conquer his
fear of rejection,

15.49.text:
he actually actively sought
out different rejections.

19.33.text:
And he had all these
crazy little kind

22.01.text: of stories going along with it.

24.04.text: So he is also a viral superstar.

28.51.text:
He has over five million

31.63.text:
So that's going to
be one of his videos

34.12.text: that he might show you today.

35.78.text:
And he's also a member

37.84.text:
His wife is actually one
of our program managers

42.62.text:
So without further
ado, please help

44.89.text:
me give Jia Jiang a very,
very warm Googley welcome.

80.91.text:

what I'm talking about.

84.18.text:
It's the fear of

86.25.text:
one of the biggest problems
we'll find in life.

88.67.text:
it's a terrible fear that,
yeah, keeps us in line,

91.51.text:

94.86.text:

103.82.text: And I did find that solution.

109.20.text:
and precisely the
two versions of me--

112.16.text:
we're Silicon Valley,

114.63.text:
So the version 1.0
is all about gifts.

121.03.text:
Well, when I was a
six-year-old, I got my gift.

126.68.text:
My first grade teacher
had a brilliant idea--

134.48.text:
She wanted us to experience
receiving gifts as well

139.98.text:
as learning the virtue of
complimenting each other.

142.70.text:
So she had all of us come

145.52.text:
And she bought all of

147.71.text: and stacked them in the corner.

149.00.text:
And she said, why
don't we come here

150.76.text:
and just compliment each
other and say nice things.

153.61.text:
And if you hear your name
called by another student,

157.05.text:
you go pick up your
gift and sit down.

164.46.text:
Well, when he started,
there were 40 of us.

166.84.text:
And every time when
someone's name was called,

169.44.text:
I would give the
hardiest cheer whether it

171.87.text:
was a good student helpful
to teachers and whatever.

178.62.text:
And then there were 20 left,
10 left, 5 left, and 3 left.

184.74.text: And I was one of them.

189.18.text:
At that time I didn't want
to compliment anymore.

193.10.text: I didn't want my gift anymore.

194.76.text: I just wanted to sit down.

197.42.text:
And the teacher though--
she was just freaking out.

200.85.text:
And she was like would
anyone say anything nice

206.71.text:
OK, why don't you

208.29.text:
and sit down so you behave
better next year-- someone will

213.37.text: So that was one version of me.

216.28.text:
And I would die now to be in
that situation again getting

Then fast forward eight
years-- when I was 14.

228.21.text:
I grew up in

230.40.text:
And this guy came to

234.40.text:
I was in the

236.96.text:
I know he's not

238.38.text: But at the time, he was it.

241.12.text:
And by the way, I have no
idea why this pictures is in

246.63.text:
It wasn't like in

248.70.text:
or General Patton was

251.08.text:
But I guess I didn't have any
Android or iPhone back then.

256.52.text:
But he came to my
home town to speak.

258.14.text:
I was just mesmerized by
his idea-- by his story.

262.16.text:
I loved his idea of using
technology to change the world.

266.27.text: And I just want to be like him.

268.30.text:
And that night I wrote a letter
to my family and telling them,

271.96.text:
hey, by age 25, I will build the
biggest company in the world.

278.65.text:
I just solely embraced this
idea of dominating the world

283.32.text: And then I didn't make this up.

289.68.text:
The first line says, no, I'm not
going to go through this line

292.76.text:
But I did highlight
some key words

294.18.text:
so you know what
I'm talking about.

296.76.text:
In that letter, I also wrote I
will come to the United States

301.95.text:
someday to fulfill that dream
because, well, first of all,

308.32.text: I wanted to be where he lives.

310.46.text:
But also, remember
that year there

312.82.text:
was a movie that was called
"True Lies" that came out.

316.55.text:
And that was my-- still my
favorite movie of all time.

320.93.text:
In that movie, Arnold
Schwarzenegger he

322.61.text:
was like jumping through

326.39.text:
and hanging on helicopters
and saving the world.

329.41.text: And I am like that's America.

331.06.text: That's where I want to be.

332.62.text:
So I came when I was 16 under
a cultural exchange program

340.21.text:
And so I thought that's
the start of my dream--

344.58.text:
And then fast forward
another 14 years.

350.71.text:
And I did not build the
biggest company in the world.

355.71.text:
And even at work, I
feel very stagnant.

360.11.text:
I just felt-- I
mean, from outside

363.49.text:
I was working in one of the
biggest companies in the world.

366.82.text:
And I was collecting
good income.

369.45.text:
A lot of people were
asking me for jobs.

371.95.text:
But then I-- but I still didn't
do the things I wanted to do.

376.75.text: I didn't go after my dreams.

378.91.text:
Even at work, every time I
feel like I have a new idea--

383.41.text:
every time I want to make
a new proposal-- every time

386.01.text:
I want to speak in a
group-- every time I want

388.28.text:
to step up and do
something, I just

390.77.text:
felt there was this constant
battle between the six-year-old

396.49.text: One wanted to change the world.

404.05.text:
And every time that
six-year-old won out.

407.69.text:
And so I just feel maybe
I missed the boat-- maybe

413.06.text:
And so I started my-- this
fear of rejection even extended

417.16.text: after I started my own company.

419.30.text:
I started my own
company when I was 30.

421.21.text:
If you're going
to be Bill Gates,

422.58.text:
you got to start
sooner or later, right?

426.04.text:
And four months
into my venture, I

433.30.text:
I was hurt so bad that I
wanted to quit right there.

438.43.text:
I was just having-- I just
thought this six-year-old was

442.88.text: Who do you think you are?

444.31.text:
Start ups are for the
geniuses like Bill Gates

447.26.text: and Steve Jobs or Larry Page.

449.85.text: You are just a wanna be.

451.70.text:
And your friends are
going to laugh at you.

453.75.text:
And your in-laws are going to
hate you probably even more.

458.48.text:
So you should quit and
stop embarrassing yourself.

464.11.text:
And that's where
it clicked for me.

468.03.text:
And I thought would
Bill Gates give up

471.66.text:
after a simple investment
rejection like that?

480.09.text:
Would anyone successful in
their career give up like that?

484.46.text:
So I have to really put
this six year old back

488.05.text: to his place once and for all.

491.06.text:
I cannot let him
dictate my life anymore.

493.77.text: So I found how can I do this?

498.90.text:
How can overcome this
fear of rejection

500.61.text:
that's been bothering
me my whole life?

507.67.text:
I just googled how do I
overcome the fear of rejection.

511.03.text:
And then I came
up-- first of all,

512.46.text:
I came up with a bunch
of psychology articles

514.44.text:
about where the pain and
fears are coming from.

517.43.text: That didn't say anything to me.

518.88.text:
Then I ran through a bunch of
inspirational ra ra articles

522.98.text:
that talks about, hey, don't
take rejection personally.

528.34.text:
And I'm like who doesn't
know that already?

531.15.text:
If it's that simple, why
was that hurt this bad.

535.72.text: And then I came to a website.

541.33.text:
How many of you have heard of
rejection therapy, by the way?

547.42.text: OK, I'll explain this to you.

553.11.text:
It was started by this
Canadian guy-- an entrepreneur.

558.80.text:
And so, basically,
it's a game that

561.01.text:
is a flash card
game that asks you

562.74.text:
to look for rejection every day
instead of avoiding rejection.

566.83.text:
So they give you a
30-day challenge.

569.33.text:
So every day it asks you to
get rejected at something--

575.73.text:
But in 30 days,
you get rejected.

577.17.text:
But after 30 days, you
became like a badass

580.82.text:
because you desensitize yourself
from the pain of rejection.

584.35.text: And I just loved this idea.

586.09.text: I thought I'm going to do this.

587.38.text:
I'm going to do this not only
for-- not just for 30 days.

592.90.text: And I'll do this for 100 days.

594.33.text:
And I'll come up with my
own rejection attempt.

596.62.text:
I'm not going to listen to
what a flash card tells me

598.83.text:
because I have a little
bit of an authority issue.

601.38.text:
And so I'm just
using my imagination

604.68.text:
to come up with my
own rejection attempt.

606.63.text: And I will do this for 100 days.

607.96.text:
And I will use my
phone to film it.

609.92.text:
And I'll put it on YouTube
to make a video blog or vlog.

613.90.text:
And also, I will tell
the world about it

615.73.text:
so they will hold
me accountable.

617.40.text:
Otherwise, I would probably
just quit pretty quickly.

619.69.text: So this is what I did.

621.68.text:
This is what the
website looked then.

624.17.text:
Maybe you can see
rejection one--

630.51.text:
I was working in
this big building

632.23.text: in Austin Texas at the time.

633.73.text:
And I just one day
I finished work.

635.65.text:
I came down I saw this big
guy sitting behind a desk.

641.34.text: He looked like a security guard.

642.95.text:
So I just approached him and
as I was a walking toward him,

647.62.text:
I could just feel the hair
at the back of my neck

653.86.text:
And as he came, I said, hey,
can I borrow $100 from you?

658.22.text:
And he looked up me
and was like, no, why?

662.83.text:
And I just turned around
and just said, I'm sorry.

666.12.text: I just ran as fast as I could.

670.82.text:
And that night--
but you got to--

673.44.text:
because I was doing the
video because I filmed myself

676.18.text:
with my phone, I had to
experience this twice.

678.91.text:
So that night I
was seeing myself.

681.53.text:
I had to upload the
video on YouTube, right?

683.64.text:
And I just saw myself
frame by frame.

685.84.text: I just saw how scared I was.

687.69.text:
I looked like this kid from
the movie "Sixth Sense."

693.79.text: And then I saw this guy.

695.32.text: He was a chubby looking guy.

701.92.text: And he didn't pull out a club.

703.88.text:
He didn't use pepper
spray or call the police.

711.75.text:
In fact, he was inviting
me to explain myself.

714.49.text: I could have said many things.

715.74.text:
I could have said,
well, I'm trying

717.30.text:
to overcome my
fear of rejection.

719.56.text:
That's why I'm
trying to do this.

720.93.text:
Or I could have
said, OK, I'm just

722.70.text:
trying to try something new
to see if it's possible.

726.22.text:
If you give me $100 and trust
me, I'll give you $110 back.

732.76.text:
You're not going to get that
in the stock market in one day.

736.74.text:
If you don't trust me,
here's my driver's license.

739.88.text:
I could say if
you can't do $100,

741.95.text:
I can do $50--
something like that.

745.20.text: But I didn't do any of that.

746.48.text: I just ran as fast as I could.

749.17.text:
And I'm like, wow, this
is a microcosm of my life.

754.45.text:
Every time I get
rejected at something,

756.40.text:
I would just run because
it was so painful for me.

760.37.text:
So I said the next day,
no matter what happens,

766.69.text:
So rejection two--
request a burger refill.

773.25.text:
Of course, I didn't
work at Google.

774.88.text: So you can pull this off here.

776.13.text:
You get free burgers
if you are here.

777.67.text: But I went to a burger joint.

And after having a very
juicy burger for lunch,

785.35.text:
I went to the cashier and said,
hey, can I get a burger refill?

788.70.text:
I was like what's

791.23.text:
Just like a drink refill,
but with a burger.

794.57.text:
And he was like, sorry, we

797.64.text:
And so this is where
the rejection happened.

800.26.text:
And I could have just ran
right there like I did before.

804.70.text: I said, well, I love you burger.

808.75.text:
If you guys do burger refills,

811.83.text:
And I'll come back

813.38.text:
And it was like, oh, thank

815.46.text:
But sorry, we can't

817.67.text: And maybe we'll do it someday.

819.66.text:
I don't think they ever did
burger refills because I think

826.23.text:
But when I left that day, that

835.36.text:
But that life and death

840.61.text:
You know, two days in, I'm

842.69.text:
If I just don't run,

846.47.text:
And I just-- I don't have to

852.67.text:
Then something happened--

857.07.text: People started to say yes to me.

861.42.text:
So, for example, let me
see-- rejection six-- play

867.02.text:
All right, so one day

868.97.text:

872.46.text: and shin guards all decked out.

884.44.text:
And he was like
soccer in my backyard?

887.90.text: Then he saw I was all serious.

890.66.text: And he was like, I guess so.

897.06.text:
So I went into his backyard
and just bounced the ball

900.88.text:
with my foot and had him
take a picture of me.

903.59.text:
So before leaving I said,
how can you say yes?

906.21.text:
And he said, this is so off

911.32.text:
OK, then one day I--
one day I was driving.

919.32.text: And I was-- I flagged him down.

921.80.text:
I pulled the police
officer over for revenge.

926.74.text:
And I said, officer,
can I drive your car.

929.46.text:
And he was-- I'm not
going to drive it away

931.84.text:
because if I do that, I'll
probably get in trouble.

934.20.text:
But can I just sit there
and listen to your radio

937.23.text:
and feel like a police
officer and give it a spin?

940.12.text:
And he was like, OK, you
look pretty harmless.

943.01.text: So I got in a police car.

946.37.text:
And then-- in the
front, by the way.

949.87.text:
It would be different if
I was in the backseat.

952.91.text:
And then one day I said
what is something that's

954.91.text:
so impossible that
someone would-- there's

957.13.text: no way I would get a yes?

960.49.text:
By the way, I had no license
or courage or knowledge

966.61.text:
But I went to an
airfield in Austin.

968.69.text:
And I talked to this pilot
guy in the in the lobby.

972.02.text:
I said, sir, can
I fly your plane?

975.96.text: He was like, yeah, come on in.

978.57.text: I'll teach you how to fly.

983.20.text:
And it turned out he
didn't own a commercial jet

988.33.text:
It's like a small plane--
like a miniature helicopter

992.25.text:
type of thing-- or maybe
like a motorcycle in the air.

995.52.text:
And he's an
enthusiast-- a hobbyist.

998.86.text:
And he wanted to show everyone
his awesome gyro plane.

1001.72.text:
So he was so happy
that I approached him.

1004.51.text:
And then there's one day that
my life got turned upside down.

1010.84.text: It's never been the same sense.

1013.27.text:
Day three-- ask for
Olympic symbol donuts.

1016.84.text:
How many of you
have seen the video?

1021.56.text:
OK, I got to show
the video then.

1030.01.text: I'm driving to a Krispy Kreme.

1033.07.text:
I'm going to,
well, I don't know.

1034.71.text:
I just got my hair
cut yesterday.

1036.33.text:
I look like a Viet
Cong from the 1960s.

1040.71.text:
I'm going to grow
into it or my hair

1043.12.text:
is going to grow
into me either way.

1048.34.text:
I'm going to ask them to make

JACKIE: What kind of specialized

JIA JIANG: I'd like

you link the five

1106.07.text:

1111.46.text:

1117.54.text:

1121.66.text:

1138.43.text:

1140.35.text: and then drop in the fryer.

And it was the red,

1158.35.text:
JIA JIANG: Red, green,

1168.98.text:
Oh, my gosh, I haven't watched

1171.43.text:
that-- I may not be able to

1184.31.text:
JACKIE: The only thing

1185.98.text:
is if i try to put those
through the proofer,

1190.23.text:
And then once they hit the

And if they hit that, they

1199.68.text:
JIA JIANG: If you could make

Sometimes you make

1316.86.text:
Jackie who works for Krispy

1325.94.text:

By the way, it was

the experience.

1358.74.text:
By the way, when
that was happening,

1360.24.text: I remember Tracy was calling me.

1362.36.text:
And she was like,
hey, dinner's ready.

1364.17.text:
I'm like, hey, just

1370.18.text:
So I just couldn't believe

1374.17.text:
or human kindness that

1376.63.text:
If you own a business,
don't you want

1378.18.text:

to run your business?

And the world couldn't

1385.58.text:

it got over five million

1391.93.text:
And it was on the front page
of like some newspapers-- front

1399.08.text:
It was on newspapers--
media across the world.

And "Business Week" even

1408.51.text:
to find out what I was

1410.66.text:
I used to think I
love "Business Week."

1413.72.text:
I used to think I got to

1415.89.text:
And I got to become this

1419.08.text:
to actually be on "Business

1423.86.text:
But the thing is some sort of

if you can get on

So I started putting

and trying to find

1750.11.text:
What about ideas come

But when it comes

nothing more than the preference

So when you make

1809.09.text:
the person sizes you up

Maybe it's based on

1826.38.text: come up for a whole lifetime.

Maybe it's his or

But somehow when it

1836.56.text: we think it's all about us.

We think it's some

1842.57.text:
But also it's like an

1845.53.text: or the merit of our idea.

But I often tell people if

1873.26.text:
And better yet, if you

1875.55.text:
to your advantage,
you can't exercise.

1878.24.text:
You can use your rejection

1884.85.text:
Every day I put myself just
outside my comfort zone.

1887.82.text:
And I went out and asked
and asked and asked.

And gradually my

And so right now

as part of my
business right now is

a gym for the mind

or your courage is really

I want to a pretty

So, for example,

maximize your chance

the other people a
doubt they might have

2021.53.text:
or maybe a weakness

in your argument,

And those doubts

2049.70.text:
But if I mention their doubt

2053.56.text:
Actually, I can totally maximize

That's from my
days of rejection.

2226.94.text:

So and then I also learned

2268.78.text:
say no to people in a nice

I found out that

It's tougher for

If you say no to people, you

So it's the same type

2293.36.text: of flip side of the coin.

And so but I learned

2297.55.text:
can say the right thing and

I would just walk

So one thing I

2316.07.text:
act-- when you reject

as a person, but you are

2327.68.text:
And so one day I went to

2331.82.text:
I went to a Costco and

2358.19.text:

But the thing is not only

2410.89.text:
So how can I feel bad when

So there are just a lot

2416.37.text:
For time-- for reason
of time, there's

2417.97.text:
one last thing I
just want to share

2419.61.text: with you is just two words.

This is the most important

2427.23.text:
I remember, I told you flew
someone's plane right once.

2432.54.text:
When I think about
flying, I really

2434.46.text:
think about just going to the

2438.11.text:
and shoes walking through

2440.82.text:
and get scanned by

2443.32.text:
And it will give me

2446.47.text:

2451.93.text: That day I flew like a bird.

2456.09.text:
And just for one minute,
I was a couple feet

2460.18.text:
I felt like a seagull looking

2474.70.text:
But then all this
time, there's only one

2477.12.text:
thing I could think
about was what

2480.30.text: if I hadn't asked this person?

2483.15.text:
I would not have that

2486.12.text:
Then in our lives what
if we don't ask stuff?

2488.59.text:
Maybe companies
might not be built.

2493.04.text:

The reason we don't

think the rejection is something

2506.34.text:
as well going back to our

2511.52.text:
We would try everything to

And so by avoiding a negatives,

2519.56.text:
That's actually just a

2521.82.text:
every day because when we're not

2524.56.text:
and asking, we're just getting--

ourselves by default. And we're

So I just tell you,

2534.26.text: don't get ignored by the world.

Rejection was my

turned this into my biggest

how to quantify their fear

2733.37.text:
